title: Momentum of box across frictionless floor

content.question: A <math alttext="2 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> box is pushed from rest across a horizontal surface where friction between the box and the surface is negligible. Students record the applied force at several equally spaced positions while pushing the box and create the graph shown. The change in momentum of the box is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="2 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math alttext="6 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math alttext="12 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math alttext="36 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>36</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="12 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
